meanings.definition: A person or thing that moves earth or excavates land.
meanings.sent1: The earthmover used a shovel to dig up the dirt.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker operated the earthmover to clear the site.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to be an earthmover, scooping up sand with his toy truck.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an earthmover, clearing any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The massive earthmover rumbled through the field, reshaping the landscape.

meanings.definition: A machine designed for moving large quantities of earth or soil.
meanings.sent1: The earthmover at the construction site had huge tires for stability.
meanings.sent2: The company invested in a new earthmover to speed up the excavation process.
meanings.sent3: The earthmover seemed to have a mind of its own, chugging along the dirt.
meanings.sent4: The earthmover roared to life, devouring the earth in its path.
meanings.sent5: The earthmover's engine hummed as it effortlessly pushed mounds of soil aside.
